noun.description: (chiefly in military contexts) a turn made so as to face the opposite direction.
examples: he did an about-turn and marched out of the tent

verb.description: Turn so as to face the opposite direction.
examples: suddenly he about-turned and saluted again

exclamation.description: A military command to make an about-turn.

origin: Late 19th century (originally as a military command): shortening of right about turn.
